title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 November 2013 - XWiki
content:

09:04 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <vmassol> good morning  
09:04 <cjd> is now known as <Guest34105>  
09:04 <vmassol> wow: JFreeChart 1.0.17 is out!  
09:04 <vmassol> after so many years, it's not dead :)  
09:05 <Guest34105> What happens if you release a piece of software and it is perfect? Doing another release is by definition wrong isn't it?  
09:05 <tmortagne> vmassol: according to the website they did 3 releases in 2013  
09:05 <vmassol> Guest34105: perfect software doesn't exist :)  
09:06 <Guest34105> been too long in the java world xD  
09:06 <vmassol> tmortagne: yep, just seen it, hadn't realized.Must be someone who took over  
09:06 <tmortagne> now it's not like it was major version either  
09:06 <Guest34105> Also good morning :)  
09:06 <vmassol> Guest34105: is that caleb hiding? :)  
09:07 <vmassol> (you cannot hide, when someone makes deprecatory comments about java I know it's you! :)  
09:07 <Guest34105> the sasl thingy with freenode is not working so it's force-renicking me.. \*shrug\*  
09:07 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <Guest34105> is now known as <\_cjd>  
09:08 <\_cjd> this weekend I rewrote the build for cjdns, scrapped cmake entirely and it's not manually scripted in node.js  
09:08 <\_cjd> went from 60 second clean builds to 5  
09:08 <vmassol> \_cjd: btw since cjdns is perfect, that should give you more time to work on xwiki, that's pretty cool :)  
09:09 <\_cjd> cjdns is far from perfect :)  
09:09 <vmassol> come on, it's not in Java!  
09:09 <vmassol> must be perfect  
09:09 <\_cjd> also I can now do embedded js in .c files   #define COMPILE\_TIME\_RAMDOM <?js return Math.floor(Math.random()\*1000) ?>  
09:09 <\_cjd> :]  
09:11 <\_cjd> also about 700 lines of js to replace about 3000 lines of cmake script  
09:11 <j-simard> has quit  
09:13 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <andrewmcveigh|wo> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <vmassol> tmortagne: Do you remember if we allow writing Provider<List<SomeComponentRole>>? I think no but it could be nice to support it somehow (ie the ability to dynamically call CM.getInstanceList())  
09:37 <vmassol> ah we do  
09:37 <vmassol> :)  
09:37 <vmassol> cool  
09:37 <vmassol> just checked GenericProvider  
09:41 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes we should support it  
09:42 <tmortagne> it just take the generic Type whatever it is  
09:42 <vmassol> yep I see Map is supported too  
09:43 <tmortagne> ha you mean special support  
09:43 <vmassol> getInstanceList and getInstanceMap  
09:43 <vmassol> yep  
09:43 <vmassol> vs getInstance  
09:47 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <j-simard> has quit  
09:54 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <j-simard> has quit  
10:11 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <Kaisen> Hello, is here someone how can guide me where I can found some additional informations for the FullCalendar Apllication (http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/FullCalendar+Application)  
10:18 <camil7> ah, reminds me I wanted to upload our variant which combines this with the plain "calendar" extension ...  
10:19 <camil7> what "additional information" is missing, actually?  
10:19 <vmassol> camil7: would be cool :)  
10:21 <Kaisen> I install the extension. I can inplement the calendar view into a wiki page. But I don't have any idea how to add now an event :(  
10:21 <Kaisen> What did you mean with plain "calendar" extension?  
10:22 <vmassol> Kaisen: see "Example of JSON generation from a wiki page:"  
10:23 <vmassol> what's missing to improve the extension is an XObject for adding events  
10:23 <vmassol> and then have the JSON that looks for those Event XObjects  
10:23 <vmassol> not hard to do  
10:23 <vmassol> ATM this extension is generic  
10:23 <vmassol> ie you can get the events from wherever you wish  
10:24 <vmassol> all you need is to modify the wiki page that generates the JSON  
10:24 <Kaisen> I look at the Example. But what should I do with that?  
10:24 <vmassol> actually what's missing in the documentation are the changes that Ludovic brought  
10:24 <vmassol> as usual he didn't document anything  
10:24 <vmassol> I've pinged him several times to add the doc but it didn't work…  
10:25 <Kaisen> If I c&p it to a wiki page nothing happen instead that I see [{"id":111,"title":"Event1","start":"2013-11-25","url":"http:\/\/yahoo.com\/"},{"id":222,"title":"Event2","start":"2012-06-20","end":"2012-06-22","url":"http:\/\/yahoo.com\/"}] on the side  
10:25 <vmassol> " • a new default JSONService to lookup for document with a specific classname with a date field and an optional duration field (the class and fields names are provided as parameter to the macro). For instance you can query Blog posts with this default JSON Service  
10:25 <vmassol> "  
10:25 <vmassol> that's from teh release notes  
10:25 <vmassol> so it seems ludovic coded it  
10:25 <vmassol> he just didn't document it  
10:26 <vmassol> Kaisen: it should work fine if you follow the instructions  
10:26 <camil7> Kaisen:  the code should be in a separate page, that is "ExampleJSON" in space "Calendar" in  case of the docs  
10:27 <camil7> in case of the example given in the docs, I meant  
10:27 <Kaisen> vmassol which insturctions?  
10:28 <Kaisen> Forget what I ask  
10:28 <vmassol> Kaisen: hold on, adding more doc  
10:29 <Kaisen> What was missing is the information that I have a Calender space after installing the extenstion  
10:29 <Kaisen> extension  
10:31 <vmassol> Kaisen: should be slightly better now  
10:32 <vmassol> ludovic is going to add more information for the new features he added in 1.1 and beyond  
10:32 <Kaisen> Yes now it's fine :)  
10:32 <Kaisen> It's great to see here the fast support !  
10:33 <vmassol> cool  
10:36 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki

14:19 <sburjan> Denis: ping  
14:19 <Denis> sburjan: pong  
14:20 <sburjan> Denis: I am testing the rights, and I'm lost :)  
14:20 <sburjan> let's go private  
14:44 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
14:48 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
15:08 <camil7> anyone ever experiences the problem that (local) admin users do not see the rights in their subwiki? i.e the admin UI is visible, and there are XWikiGlobalRights objects stored on the XWikiPreferences, but they are just not shown in the "Rights" section in the admin UI  
15:18 <tmortagne> camil7: which version ?  
15:19 <camil7> um, actually 5.0.3; data migrated straight  from 2.1.1  
15:20 <camil7> so it is probably just me ... however just asking if this sounds like a known issue (did not find anything in the issue tracker, but sometimes I have bad search karma )  
15:20 <tmortagne> you upgrade the WAR but did you upgraded the pages ?  
15:21 <tmortagne> you go to admin rights section and you see a blanc page or what exactly ?  
15:21 <tmortagne> a screenshot would be great  
15:22 <tmortagne> if you see the right setup but just don't have any listed group/user it may be because you just don't have users/groups in that wiki for some reason  
15:22 <tmortagne> s/setup/UI/  
15:23 <tmortagne> why 5.0.3 btw and not a more recent version ?  
15:23 <tmortagne> unless you did that upgrade some time ago (sounded like a recent upgrade in your message)  
15:25 <camil7> well, I did the upgrade last week, and because it is a big version jump already we did not upgrade any further, especially with the changes in the wiki-manager and stuff  
15:27 <camil7> and, yes, we imported a new xwiki-enterprise-ui-5.0.3.xar over the old pages ... as we had no DW yet, we had to do it manually ... most probably messed something up  
15:28 <camil7> most probably some obscure issue with my migration procedure - I will debug some more. just wanted to ask in case it rings a bell with someone. if it does not, not worth looking into the issue, it is just me  
15:28 <tmortagne> could be related to XWikiPreference syntax which you probably skipped to not loose your configuration  
15:29 <tmortagne> try to switch it to xwiki/2.1 if it's still 1.0 to see  
15:30 <camil7> fortunately the XWikiGlobalRights are still there as objects .... ah, yes, I did switch the syntax to xwiki/2.1(the Admin UI has bar {pre} tags otherwise ;) ), but that need some manual fixes afterward  
15:49 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
15:51 <fmancinelli> Hi everybody... Quick question... Do we have an API for getting the "pretty name" of a user (e.g. his name and surname) ?  
15:56 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: $xwiki.getUserName($userid, false) from velocity  
15:59 <fmancinelli> thanks tmortagne  
16:07 <vmassol> tmortagne: funny, it seems that when deploying XWiki on a CDI-enabled system, CDI is confused by our atinject annotations (cf email on the list)… will need to do some tests  
16:08 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes I seen the weird errors, so this means that CDI scan the jars for all classes containing those annotations ?  
16:08 <vmassol> well normally no  
16:08 <vmassol> normally you have to decalre a beans.xml in META-INF  
16:09 <vmassol> at least in CDI 1.0  
16:09 <vmassol> probably still true in 1.1  
16:09 <vmassol> now maybe Glassfish does some magic  
16:09 <tmortagne> then I don't understand how it was able to find those classes  
16:09 <vmassol> no idea ATM  
16:12 <camil7> random note about my migration problem: seems that in ancient times (e.g. XWiki 2.1) rights in subwikis were stored with user references as wikiname:XWiki.UserName  instead of just  XWiki.UserName ... I guess if I update that in the DB, my problems go away  
16:13 <vmassol> mfmflorea: Hi, what's your status re XWIKI-9508 ?  
16:14 <vmassol> I'm getting worried that it's being pushed late when I believe it's the most important issue for SOLR in 5.3 ;) (also a hard one)  
16:15 <tmortagne> camil7: there is no reason the full reference does not work, putting a relative reference is just optimization  
16:15 <lucaa> has quit  
16:15 <tmortagne> if it does not work you should report it since that would be a bug  
16:15 <camil7> yes, the relative reference works well in the rights check, but it seems it does not work in the UI  
16:16 <tmortagne> but I would be suprised since global users are referenced with full reference (no other way)  
16:16 <tmortagne> then that's definitely a bug  
16:16 <camil7> ah, it should work even there, too - hm, not sure if it is worth reporting, as it only seems to happen when you migrate out of the late stone ages, so to say  
16:17 <camil7> and yes, it fully works for global users, which are references with the 'xwiki':  prefix  
16:17 <camil7> ok, if it is a bug, I better check the code instead of wondering how to migrate the data, thanks!  
16:20 <tmortagne> camil7: whatever possible migration issue, having a different behavior with relative and full reference is a bug IMO  
16:21 <camil7> yes, I am looking into it if it is really a bug in the code or in front of the keyboard ;)  thanks for the pointer!  
16:21 <tmortagne> you're welcome :)  
16:29 <chalx> has quit  
16:29 <camil7> tmortagne: the UI greps the user reference from the "users" property (which is a "long string"), like:  $pers.matches("^(.\*,)?${regextool.quote($username)}(,.\*)?$")   ($pers being the value of the XWikiGlobalRights 'users' property, $username the non-prefixed user name for every user in the table) ... thats why it does not find my users  which are redudantly prefixed  (in /templates/getusersandgroups.vm) ... I guess it "breaking through the abstraction" o  
16:31 <tmortagne> camil7: I see, so the UI is a bit dumb  
16:32 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:33 <tmortagne> it could be nice if you could report it on jira, sounds like a easy candidate for next Bug Fixing Day ;)  
16:33 <tmortagne> unless it's been fixed in more recent version but I don't remember commits in that area  
16:34 <camil7> yes, ok, I will write a bug report; maybe even with a patch, except that all what I can think of is .. a bit ugly ;)  
16:36 <tmortagne> at worst it will be good inspiration anyway if it's to ugly ;)  
16:48 <\_cjd> vmassol: wanna invite me back into the skype dev chat? I just typed /window close in the wrong window and my setup doesn't actually have a way to get it back  
16:49 <vmassol> ahah  
16:49 <vmassol> done  
16:49 <\_cjd> I really ought to filter commands that I'm not supposed to be sending to that server because it mostly works as long as I don't touch anything  
17:03 <Kaisen> has quit  
17:04 <vmassol> guys have I sent a proposal to delay the 5.3 release on the devs list? I don't remember and can't find it agzin  
17:04 <vmassol> ah found it  
17:04 <vmassol> so 2 more days before RC1 release  
17:04 <vmassol> well one more day  
17:04 <vmassol> release is planned on Wenesday
